IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ADVANCE THE SAFETY, INDEPENDENCE, AND ECONOMIC STABILITY OF THOSE MOST AFFECTED BY POVERTY, RACISM, AND OTHER STRUCTURALLY OPPRESSIVE SYSTEMS BY INCREASING ACCESS TO JUSTICE AND WORKING FOR SYSTEMIC SOLUTIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ADVANCE THE SAFETY, INDEPENDENCE, AND ECONOMIC STABILITY OF THOSE MOST AFFECTED BY POVERTY, RACISM, AND OTHER STRUCTURALLY OPPRESSIVE SYSTEMS BY INCREASING ACCESS TO JUSTICE AND WORKING FOR SYSTEMIC SOLUTIONS.
IRS990.Desc: IN 2022, MAP (MIADVOCACY.ORG) HANDLED 20,651 CASES AND HELPED 40,342 PEOPLE. THIS INCLUDES HELPING 20,864 PEOPLE THROUGH OUR LOCAL FIELD OFFICES (LEGAL SERVICES OF SOUTH CENTRAL MICHIGAN; LSSCM.ORG) WITH CIVIL ISSUES SUCH AS FAMILY LAW, EVICTIONS, OTHER HOUSING MATTERS, DEBTS, AND ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE. THROUGH OUR STATEWIDE PROGRAMS (MICHIGAN STATEWIDE ADVOCACY SERVICES; MICHIGANSAS.ORG), WE RESPONDED TO 1,160 SUPPORT REQUESTS (TRAINING, CASE CONSULTANT AND/OR RESEARCH); WE CONDUCTED 28 TASK FORCE MEETINGS REACHING 1,558 PEOPLE; THE MICHIGAN LEGAL HELP WEBSITE HAD 3.6 MILLION PAGEVIEWS AND HELPED MORE THAN 60,000 PEOPLE PREPARE LEGAL FORMS; GUIDED 101,246 PEOPLE TO REFERRALS TO LEGAL INFORMATION; AND LAUNCHED 11 NEW ARTICLES AND SIX NEW DO-IT-YOURSELF TOOLS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MICHIGAN PLP, LLC COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES FOR TIME SPENT ON DIRECT LOBBYING WITH LEGISLATORS ON ISSUES FALLING WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIORITIES

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART IV, LINE 2B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FUNDS ARE HELD IN ESCROW FOR CLIENTS AND ARE REPORTED AS BOTH AN ASSET AND A LIABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION.

VOLUNTEERS MAINLY CONSIST OF OUTSIDE ATTORNEYS AND LAW STUDENTS PROVIDING LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO MAP CLIENTS ON A PRO-BONO BASIS.
THE FINANCE DIRECTOR AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEW THE FORM IN DETAIL. AFTER THIS REVIEW, IT IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH REQUEST FOR FEEDBACK.

EACH DIRECTOR SIGNS A STATEMENT AFFIRMING THAT THEY HAVE RECEIVED A COPY OF THE POLICY, HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, AND HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY. THE BOARD WILL TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION IN THE EVENT THAT AN EMPLOYEE OR BOARD MEMBER HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE AN ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY AND PERFORMANCE IS EVALUATED BY THE BOARD EVERY TWO YEARS. THE BOARD HAS A COMMITTEE THAT REVIEWS SALARIES OF OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS AS WELL AS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY AND PERFORMANCE.

THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEWS THE SALARIES OF KEY STAFF ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO TAKES PART IN AN ANNUAL SURVEY, FROM WHICH RESULTS COME THAT GIVE INSIGHT ON EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION AT COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS. THIS INSIGHT IS USED TO AID IN DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA GUIDESTAR.ORG OR UPON REQUEST.
HOTLINE 442,108 0 0 PARTNER AGENCY PASSTHROUGH 1,362,794 0 0 OTHER CONTRACT SERVICES 1,128,705 145,975 1,358 TOTAL 2,933,607 145,975 1,358

MICHIGAN STATEWIDE ADVOCACY SERVICES (MSAS)(MICHIGANSAS.ORG), PROVIDES BROAD SUPPORT FOR LEGAL AID PROGRAMS ACROSS MICHIGAN, SPECIFICALLY PROVIDING TRAINING AND EXPERT LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO OTHER AGENCIES. ITS STAFF ALSO SERVES POPULATIONS WITH SPECIFIC LEGAL CHALLENGES INCLUDING IMMIGRANT COMMUNITIES (MICHIGAN IMMIGRANT RIGHTS CENTER), FAMILIES FACING FORECLOSURE (MICHIGAN FORECLOSURE PREVENTION PROJECT), VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS (MICHIGAN ELDER JUSTICE INITIATIVE)(MEJI),VICTIMS OF CRIME AND VIOLENCE (CRIME VICTIMS LEGAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT), AND SELF-REPRESENTED LITIGANTS (MICHIGAN LEGAL HELP PROGRAM).
